pr_title: Cape and Elytra mappings for PlayerEntity

timeline.bodyText: I feel like updateRidingMotionStats would work a little better, but personal preference.
timeline.author: Pyrofab
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -64,9 +77,14 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1657 net/minecraft/entity/player/PlayerEntity
 	METHOD method_7258 isSpawnForced ()Z
 	METHOD method_7259 incrementStat (Lnet/minecraft/class_3445;)V
 		ARG 1 stat
+	METHOD method_7260 increaseRidingMotionStats (DDD)V

replies.bodyText: I agree, however I went with this due to other places already using names like increaseStat
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: This name is fine. The update is strictly incremental.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Marking these as "resolved" then, as it applied to both this method and the travel variant below.
replies.author: Sollace

timeline.bodyText: Same here, I'd personally go for updateTravelMotionStats.
timeline.author: Pyrofab
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -95,6 +113,10 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1657 net/minecraft/entity/player/PlayerEntity
 	METHOD method_7280 getSpawnPosition ()Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;
 	METHOD method_7281 incrementStat (Lnet/minecraft/class_2960;)V
 		ARG 1 stat
+	METHOD method_7282 increaseTravelMotionStats (DDD)V

replies.bodyText: I feel like vx is clear enough, but velocityX works too.

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -112,13 +134,18 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1657 net/minecraft/entity/player/PlayerEntity
 		ARG 1 spawnPos
 		ARG 2 allowNonBed
 	METHOD method_7289 setPlayerSpawn (Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;ZZ)V
+		ARG 1 pos
+		ARG 2 forced
+		ARG 3 announceChange
 	METHOD method_7290 dropSelectedItem (Z)Z
 		ARG 1 dropEntireStack
 	METHOD method_7291 openHorseInventory (Lnet/minecraft/class_1496;Lnet/minecraft/class_1263;)V
 	METHOD method_7292 getLuck ()F
 	METHOD method_7293 vanishCursedItems ()V
 	METHOD method_7294 canModifyWorld ()Z
 	METHOD method_7295 updateWaterSubmersionState ()Z
+	METHOD method_7296 dropShoulderEntity (Lnet/minecraft/class_2487;)V
+		ARG 1 compound

timeline.bodyText: Although this is technically used to spread items around when dying, this could be used on a single stack - in which case it sounds like it would split the stack. I think randomToss would be a little more explicit maybe ?
timeline.author: Pyrofab

replies.bodyText: The method only ever takes one stack. randomToss works, I supposed, but I can't help but wonder if there's a better term to describe it. randomToss sounds too Engrish.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: spill should suffice (with comment)
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Not sure what "too engrish" means here, but if you want conciseness "spill" works fine.
replies.author: Pyrofab

replies.bodyText: I think spreadItems is the clearest out of all of these. I immediately understand what it means, but I wouldn't know what "spill" or "randomToss" mean.
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: Let's continue using spreadItems and add a jd comment on what it means.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: I very much disagree. When I saw spreadItems, my first thought was "wait, there is a way to automatically split a stack when dropping it ?".
replies.author: Pyrofab

replies.bodyText: Wait a minute. So this doesn't split the stack to throw the individual items in random directions? In that case, I agree spreadItems is a very bad name for this.
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: Nop, it's for adding random velocity when dropping the item (eg. For spreading the stacks around you when you die)
replies.author: Pyrofab

replies.bodyText: spew
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: throwRandomly
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: I think "scatter" is already used in yarn (ItemScatterer etc).
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: But it doesn't scatter the items in the stack! It only throws the stack, as a single entity, in a random direction.
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: That's what ItemScatterer does as well.
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: No, ItemScatterer takes a list of stacks and scatters them in random directions.
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: I'm partial towards spill
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: ItemScatterer -> ItemSpiller 🤔
replies.author: Sollace

timeline.author: Juuxel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -64,9 +77,14 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1657 net/minecraft/entity/player/PlayerEntity
 	METHOD method_7258 isSpawnForced ()Z
 	METHOD method_7259 incrementStat (Lnet/minecraft/class_3445;)V
 		ARG 1 stat
+	METHOD method_7260 increaseRidingMotionStats (DDD)V
+		ARG 1 vx
+		ARG 3 vy
+		ARG 5 vz

replies.bodyText: velocityX/Y/Z plz
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: My choice was X/Y/Z imo. I don't see the need to specify that it's velocity, but @Pyrofab suggested this change.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: Does this method just increase the stat by sqrt(vx^2 + vy^2 + vz^2)? If yes, the parameters could be named dx dy dz, since they're just coordinate differences.
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: yes use dx/y/z or deltaX/Y/Z if it's the case, just d preferred
replies.author: liach

timeline.author: Juuxel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -95,6 +113,10 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1657 net/minecraft/entity/player/PlayerEntity
 	METHOD method_7280 getSpawnPosition ()Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;
 	METHOD method_7281 incrementStat (Lnet/minecraft/class_2960;)V
 		ARG 1 stat
+	METHOD method_7282 increaseTravelMotionStats (DDD)V
+		ARG 1 vx
+		ARG 3 vy
+		ARG 5 vz

timeline.bodyText: These should be *ElytraFlying because it specifically checks for elytras.
timeline.author: Juuxel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -54,6 +64,9 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_1657 net/minecraft/entity/player/PlayerEntity
 	METHOD method_21823 shouldCancelInteraction ()Z
 	METHOD method_21824 shouldDismount ()Z
 	METHOD method_21825 clipAtLedge ()Z
+	METHOD method_23668 checkFallFlying ()Z
+	METHOD method_23669 startFallFlying ()V
+	METHOD method_23670 stopFallFlying ()V

replies.bodyText: Don't think it's elytra; moving while falling count as well (like there's a stat)
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: 23668 only does anything if (itemStack2.getItem() == Items.ELYTRA && ElytraItem.isUsable(itemStack2)) { (where the stack is the item in the chest slot)
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText:
Maybe it's only method_23668 that's hardcoded for elytras 🤔
Edit: isFallFlying is also used in ElytraSoundInstance and ElytraEntityModel. I guess this enum is where "fall flying" comes from:
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: That's correct. If it weren't for the enum, I would have called it "gliding", because that's essentially what it is...
replies.author: Sollace

timeline.message: Cape and Elytra mappings for PlayerEntity

Apply suggestions from code review

Co-Authored-By: Pyrofab <redstoneinfire@gmail.com>
